subject: Re: [junit] Running JUnit tests against a .jar file
msgSnippet: sdny, What you have so far appears reasonable on first glance.  Can you use a similar classpath to run a main method from your jar? David Saff
messageBody:
sdny,

What you have so far appears reasonable on first glance. Can you use
a similar classpath to run a "main" method from your jar?

David Saff

On 8/28/07, sdny_mo <sdny_mo@...> wrote:
> Hi guys, I have a jar file with a bunch of classes inside it...how can
> i run my JUnit tests (which are in a completely different folder)
> against the classes in the jar?
>
> Any help will be appreciated, a working example would be great.
>
> Thanks!
>
>
> This is what i have so far....but no luck :(
>
> !----------------------------------------------------------
> <target name="run-tests" depends="compile">
>
> <junit printsummary="yes" haltonfailure="no"
> showoutput="yes" >
> <classpath>
> <pathelement path="${build}"/>
> <pathelement
> location="jar\path\FiletoRunTestAgainst.jar" />
> <pathelement location="${build}" />
> <pathelement path="${java.class.path}" />
> </classpath>
>
> <batchtest fork="yes" todir="${reports}/raw/">
> <formatter type="xml"/>
> <fileset dir="${src}">
> <include name="**/*Test*.java"/>
> </fileset>
> </batchtest>
> </junit>
> </target>
>
> <target name ="test" depends="run-tests" description="run your
> test
> suite">
> <junitreport todir="${reports}">
> <fileset dir="${reports}/raw/">
> <include name="TEST-*.xml"/>
> </fileset>
> <report format="frames" todir="${reports}\html\"/>
> </junitreport>
> </target>
> -----------------------------------------------------------------!
>
